Inadequate food and water supplies leading to dehydration, malnutrition, and exhaustion.
Harsh weather conditions such as extreme heat, cold, or rain, which can cause hypothermia or heatstroke.
Navigational challenges such as getting lost, not being able to read maps or use GPS devices, or encountering unexpected detours.
Injuries or accidents such as slipping on wet rocks, tripping on roots, or falling off cliffs.
Wildlife encounters such as bear attacks, venomous snakes, or other dangerous animals.
